page.title: International reactions to the 2011 Egyptian revolution

rev.diff:
Line 108: Line 108:
<!-- temporary spacer -->
<!-- temporary spacer -->
*{{flag|Russia}} â In a telephone conversation with Mubarak, [[Russian President|President]] [[Dmitry Medvedev]] expressed his hope that the situation would be resolved by peaceful and legal means. He also expressed the importance of guaranteeing the security of the [[Embassy of Russia in Cairo]] and Russian citizens who are still located in the country.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://eng.kremlin.ru/news/1722|title=Telephone conversation with President of Egypt Hosni Mubarak|date=3 January 2011|publisher=[[Presidential Press and Information Office]]|accessdate=4 February 2011}}</ref> Foreign Minister [[Sergey Lavrov]] sent a message to his Egyptian counterpart expressing concerns over the current situation and compassion with the people of Egypt. He also expressed hope that the Egyptian government would stabilise the situation, stating that "the stability of Egypt meets the genuine interests of both the Egyptians and the entire Middle East region," while also expressing the hope that "the Egyptian side will take comprehensive measures to ensure the safety of Russian citizens located in Egypt."<ref>[http://www.mid.ru/brp_4.nsf/0/28DA98369E67F581C3257827005664EC] (in [[Russian language|Russian]]).</ref>
*{{flag|Russia}} â In a telephone conversation with Mubarak, [[Russian President|President]] [[Dmitry Medvedev]] expressed his hope that the situation would be resolved by peaceful and legal means. He also expressed the importance of guaranteeing the security of the [[Embassy of Russia in Cairo]] and Russian citizens who are still located in the country.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://eng.kremlin.ru/news/1722|title=Telephone conversation with President of Egypt Hosni Mubarak|date=3 January 2011|publisher=[[Presidential Press and Information Office]]|accessdate=4 February 2011}}</ref> Foreign Minister [[Sergey Lavrov]] sent a message to his Egyptian counterpart expressing concerns over the current situation and compassion with the people of Egypt. He also expressed hope that the Egyptian government would stabilise the situation, stating that "the stability of Egypt meets the genuine interests of both the Egyptians and the entire Middle East region," while also expressing the hope that "the Egyptian side will take comprehensive measures to ensure the safety of Russian citizens located in Egypt."<ref>[http://www.mid.ru/brp_4.nsf/0/28DA98369E67F581C3257827005664EC] (in [[Russian language|Russian]]).</ref>

*{{flag|Slovakia}} â The Foreign Ministry condemned the violence and use of force against the protests. Slovak Minister of Foreign Affairs said that Egypt have to respect human rights and civic liberties.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.foreign.gov.sk/servlet/content?MT=/App/WCM/main.nsf/vw_ByID/ID_C0B1D004B5A332B2C1257627003301E7_EN&OpenDocument=Y&LANG=EN&TG=BlankMaster&URL=/App/WCM/Aktualit.nsf/(vw_ByID)/ID_205986550CAB3CE2C125782A002FC618 |title=Slovak MFA declaration on the situation in Egypt |publisher=Foreign.gov.sk |date= |accessdate=1 February 2011}}</ref>
*{{flag|Slovakia}} â The Foreign Ministry condemned the violence and use of force against the protests. Slovak Minister of Foreign Affairs said that Egypt have to respect human rights and civic liberties.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.foreign.gov.sk/servlet/content?MT=/App/WCM/main.nsf/vw_ByID/ID_C0B1D004B5A332B2C1257627003301E7_EN&OpenDocument=Y&LANG=EN&TG=BlankMaster&URL=/App/WCM/Aktualit.nsf/(vw_ByID)/ID_205986550CAB3CE2C125782A002FC618 |title=Slovak MFA declaration on the situation in Egypt |publisher=Foreign.gov.sk |date= |accessdate=1 February 2011}}</ref>
